title: Kimchi Pork Belly (Buta Kimchi)
ingredients: 12ounces thinly sliced skinless pork belly (see Thinly Sliced Meat) or uncured bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces
4ounces garlic chives (nira), sliced into 1-inch lengths (about 2 cups)
directions: 1. Whisk together the soy sauce, mirin, sake, oyster sauce, and sugar in a bowl and set aside.

2. Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat, then coat with the sesame oil. Add the pork belly and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring regularly, until most of the fat has rendered and the meat is cooked through.

3. Add the chives and cook until wilted, about 30 seconds. Stir in the kimchi and sauce mixture and bring to a simmer. Fold in the bean sprouts and cook for 2 to 3 more minutes, until the sauce has thickened slightly and the sprouts are wilted but still crunchy. Serve with steamed rice.
